intro: Erigeron glabellus var. yukonensis, commonly known as Yukon Daisy, is a perennial herb native to North America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its daisy-like flowers with white petals and a yellow center. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm and features gray-green, hairy leaves. It thrives in full sun and well-drained soil, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and borders. Its showy blooms appear in late spring to early summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
